## Let's just try a few things

For the labs in this class, you should be using RStudio to run R code. However, I found a shiny new toy that lets you run R code here in a browser - no R installation required!

Using the following chunk, find the solution to 10 + 2\*8 as well as (10 + 2)\*8.

```{webr-r}
1 + 1
```
